classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B2, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division C and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, or E.

The PHYS/CSC course sequences may be taken in either order.

Any Advisor Approved Elective course can go here.

12 units Approved Electives. At least one course at 300-level or above. See catalog for course options. Consultation with advisor is recommended prior to selecting Approved Electives; bear in mind your selections may impact pursuit of post-baccalaureate studies and/or goals. Other choices are also possible, and should be pre-approved in consultation with an academic advisor. Approved Electives are to be taken outside of the Mathematics department and should have significant applications to mathematics.
Any Free Elective course can go here.

Choose one of the following: MATH350, or CSC/CPE202.

MATH350 only offered spring quarter.

Any MATH Track Course can go here. Select 12 units from Track A or Track B. Only students who are pursuing a Data Science minor should select Track B. Track A: MATH335, MATH341, MATH406, MATH411, MATH414, MATH416, MATH418, MATH435, MATH437, MATH452, MATH453, MATH460, MATH461 & MATH462, MATH476, MATH482, MATH483. Track B: DATA301, DATA401 & DATA403; MATH335 or MATH435 or MATH453. Track B students should select their Approved Electives from the Statistics Category. (Note that DATA401 and DATA403 must be taken concurrently with DATA402).

Choose one of the following: MATH459, MATH460, MATH461 & MATH462.

MATH460 recommended for students in Applied Concentration.

Choose one of the following: MATH416, or MATH418.

MATH416 offered Fall of even academic years and Winter of odd academic years.
